intro: Gundlachia, commonly known as the desert morning glory, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Convolvulaceae. These plants are native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Americas, particularly in the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. They are characterized by their showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in the early morning. Gundlachia species are often found growing along rocky soils and in dry habitats, showcasing their adaptability to harsh environments. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for their ornamental value due to their vibrant colors and unique flower shapes.
